service_list.h File Reference

The service list module. Everything starts by getting the currently available service list. The service list can then be manipulated before being saved in the DB and automatically advertised in the SSID. This module is thread-safe and fork-safe as long as each thread and each child process load their own service list (i.e., the service list object must not be passed from one thread to another or from a parent process to its child). More...

Detailed Description

The service list module. Everything starts by getting the currently available service list. The service list can then be manipulated before being saved in the DB and automatically advertised in the SSID. This module is thread-safe and fork-safe as long as each thread and each child process load their own service list (i.e., the service list object must not be passed from one thread to another or from a parent process to its child).

Define Documentation

#define SERVICE_LIST_DB   "./service_list.dat"

The service list Sqlite3 DB file.

Adds a new service as the first member of the service list to be published.

Parameters:

[in] s the service to be added.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

size_t count_service ( const service_list *  sl  ) 

Count the number of elements in a service list.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list whose elements are to be counted.
Returns:
the number of services contained in the service list. If an error occured, 0 is returned.

int create_service ( struct service **  s,
unsigned long  cat_id,
char *  desc,
char *  long_desc,
char *  uri 
)

Creates a service having the specified attributes. The created service should be freed later with destroy_service(). [CAUTION] No string copy operation will be performed on desc, long_desc and uri (i.e., each of the corresponding field in the resulting struct will point to the given string) and the fields will later be freed in destroy_service() (i.e., the caller must perform the needed copy operation if the strings pointed by the fields will still be used outside the data structure).

Parameters:
[out] s the resulting service object.
[in] cat_id the mandatory category ID of the service.
[in] desc the optional description of the service for the SSID ads. NULL will omit this.
[in] long_desc the optional long description of the service. NULL will omit this.
[in] uri the mandatory URI to obtain the service.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int del_service_all ( service_list *  sl  ) 

Deletes all services.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that to be emptied.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int del_service_at ( service_list *  sl,
unsigned int  idx 
)

Deletes a service at the specified index in the service list.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that contains the service.
[in] idx the 0-based position index.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

void destroy_service ( struct service **  s  ) 

Frees the memory allocated through create_service() or get_service_at() and sets the pointer to NULL as a safe guard. Passing a pointer to NULL is okay but not a NULL pointer.

Parameters:
[in] s the service to be freed.

void destroy_service_list ( service_list **  sl  ) 

Frees the memory allocated through load_service_list() and sets the pointer to NULL as a safe guard. Passing a pointer to NULL is okay but not a NULL pointer.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list to be freed.

uint64_t get_last_modification_time ( service_list *  sl  ) 

Returns the time since Unix epoch the already published service list was last modified (this is not the last modification time of the service list that is modified but not yet saved).

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list through which the already published services are to be checked.
Returns:
the already published service list's last modification time. When an error occurs, 0 is returned.

int get_service_at ( service_list *  sl,
struct service **  s,
unsigned int  idx 
)

Gets a copy of the service at the specified index in the service list. The copy should later be freed with destroy_service().

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that has the service.
[out] s a pointer to the dynamically allocated copy of the service or a pointer to NULL if no service found at the specified index.
[in] idx the 0-based position index.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int insert_service_at ( service_list *  sl,
const struct service *  s,
unsigned int  idx 
)

Inserts a new service at the specified index in the service list. It is an error to insert a service outside the range [0, count_service() - 1].

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that will contain the new service.
[in] s the service to be added.
[in] idx the 0-based position index.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int load_service_list ( service_list **  sl  ) 

Loads the currently published service list.

Parameters:
[out] sl the pointer pointing to dynamically allocated memory that should be freed with destroy_service_list().
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int replace_service_at ( service_list *  sl,
const struct service *  s,
unsigned int  idx 
)

Replaces a service at the specified index in the service list.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list that contains the service.
[in] s the new service that will replace the old one.
[in] idx the 0-based position index.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.

int save_service_list ( const service_list *  sl  ) 

Saves the service list in the published service database and advertises the service list in the SSID accordingly.

Parameters:
[in] sl the service list to be saved.
Returns:
0 if there is no error or non-zero if there is an error.
